section.name: name
section.description: hg - an HCLI for interacting with GPT-3.5-Turbo via terminal input and output streams

section.name: synopsis
section.description: hg <command>

section.name: description
section.description: The "hg" HCLI allows you to chat with GPT 3.5 Turbo via command line. You can send content as an input stream, and the AI model will generate a response based on it.\n\nThe HCLI relies on the use of a OpenAI generated API key exported as an environment variable (i.e. export OPENAI_API_KEY='secret')

section.name: examples
section.description:
echo 'hello, how are you?' | hg chat

(echo 'inspect this cli.py file'; cat cli.py) | hg chat

hg clear

hg chat dump

hg context get > context.json

cat context.json | hg context set

command.name: chat
command.description: The "chat" command allows you to converse with ChatGPT by sending content from the input stream.

command.name: clear
command.description: The "clear" command clears the ongoing chat history and context so that you can start a fresh conversation.

command.name: context
command.description: The "context" command allows you to work with the conversation context.

section.name: description
section.description: The "chat" command allows you to work with the conversation context. The context is what makes the chatbot remember what was previously discussed so that a more coherent conversation can take place.

command.name: get
command.description: The "get" command retrieves the current conversation context.

command.name: set
command.description: The "set" command sets the context for the conversation from the input stream. The context is expected to follow the openai json context format.
